channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [AVRO-2011] AbstractMethodError on version upgrade from 1.7.7 -->1.8.1
item.description:
When I upgrade from avro version 1.7.7 to version 1.8.1 I am getting a runtime AbstractMethodError exception:-

13:07:33.334 DEBUG [Component Resolve Thread (Bundle 274)] [NumConfigProvider.java:322] Unbinding Application Configuration Service
13:07:33.880 ERROR CIL Notification callback thread #0 [FilteringLogger.java:92] Encountered error while running polling notification thread.
com.bss.cil.client.service.notification.NotificationException: Failed to poll notifications: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at com.bss.cil.client.client.msg.NotificationAdminImpl$Scanner.run(NotificationAdminImpl.java:477) [na:na]
at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471) [na:1.7.0_79]
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:304) [na:1.7.0_79]

item.environment:
Apache Avro version:- 1.8.1
Java version:- 1.7
Pax Exam integration tests for OSGI setup

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This is the known incompatibility caused by AVRO-1502.

The relevant release note from 1.8.0 was:

AVRO-1502. Java: Generated classes now implement Serializable.
Generated classes need to be regenerated to use this release. (cutting)

Please correct me if I am wrong:-
After reading this I understand that I have to delete and regenerate my Java classes from Avro schema.
We have avro schemas in the resource directory and use the mvn plugin to generate the classes like this:-

plugin>
<groupId>org.apache.avro</groupId>
<artifactId>avro-maven-plugin</artifactId>
<executions>
<execution>
<phase>validate</phase>
<goals>
<goal>schema</goal>
</goals>
<configuration>
<imports>
<!-schemas go here->
</imports>
<fieldVisibility>private</fieldVisibility>
<stringType>String</stringType>
<sourceDirectory>${project.basedir}/src/main/avro/</sourceDirectory>
<outputDirectory>${project.basedir}/target/generated-sources/</outputDirectory>
</configuration>
</execution>
</executions>
</plugin>

so this should be handled automatically for us. Still I am getting the runtime AbstractMethod error.

You're correct; if you're using the plugin then it should take care of regenerating the classes for you.

Can you recreate the error in a small example that you can share?

Hi

I tried replicating the same in a small sample application. It seems to be working fine. It seems my original project has some other libraries which have classes compiled with older version of Avro. Would have to contact the owners of corresponding libs for correction.

For now it would be good to close the issue. Sorry for the trouble.

item.title: [AVRO-2012] Build for javascript language binding is broken
item.description:
While trying to build javascript language binding:

 $ ./build.sh test

> avro-js@1.8.0 cover /Users/thiru/Projects/apache/avro/lang/js
> istanbul cover _mocha



  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․
  ․․․․․․․․․․․․․․․

  373 passing (809ms)
  8 failing

  1) protocols StatefulEmitter ok handshake:
     TypeError: this.buf.binaryWrite is not a function
...
  8) utils Tap binary write valid:
     TypeError: this.buf.binaryWrite is not a function
      at Tap.writeBinary (lib/utils.js:9:21544)
      at Context.<anonymous> (test/test_utils.js:242:13)
...
npm ERR!     npm owner ls avro-js
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /Users/thiru/Projects/apache/avro/lang/js/npm-debug.log
js (master)$
item.summary: Build for javascript language binding is broken

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Thiruvalluvan M. G. looks like the version you worked on is 1.8.
There is no utils.js class present in version 1.7.
Suraj Acharya Oops!. Here is the patch for branch-1.7, please give it a try.

Thanks for working on this Thiruvalluvan M. G..
The diff didnt apply cleanly on the branch 1.7.
I have modified it a bit so that it can be applied cleanly on branch 1.7. Can you please look at it now.

Thanks again.
Suraj Acharya Looks good to me.

Commit ca5bdfd7a18b9889ddb43e625967ca67e8dc9154 in avro's branch refs/heads/branch-1.7 from Suraj
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=avro.git;h=ca5bdfd ]

AVRO-2012 Make JS build on branch 1.7

Signed-off-by: Thiruvalluvan M G <thiru@startsmartlabs.com>
Signed-off-by: sacharya <suraj@apache.org>
Thanks Thiruvalluvan M. G. for getting this started.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The fix is rather simple. JavaScript's Buffer class no writeBinary() method, one should rather use write() method, which converts the given (sub)string into UTF and write into the buffer.
